data.title: #360stats: Venus Williams vs Serena Williams – A history of sport’s greatest sibling rivalry
data.meta_description: For any child growing up the first major rivalry during their formative years would usually be against their sibling. Usually, these rivalries that begin in bac
data.text:
For any child growing up the first major rivalry during their formative years would usually be against their sibling. Usually, these rivalries that begin in backyards and bedrooms fade as you get older and strengthen bonds between brothers and sisters.

Top level sport, however, is a less forgiving beast and has served up some remarkable sibling rivalries over the years. For possibly the greatest family battle in sport, look no further than the Williams sisters; Venus and Serena.

– US Open: Williams sisters set up quarter-final tie

– US Open: Murray prepared for Anderson test

– US Open: Cilic continues Flushing Meadows run

– US Open: Azarenka finds her inner warrior in win

They first played each other as professionals in the second round of the Australian Open in 1998, nearly 18 years at the top of the game stretching between that match and their latest head-to-head at Flushing Meadows, New York in the quarter-finals of the US Open.

Here, Sport360.com’s resident statistician Mohandas Menon looks at how the sisters have fared against each other in their 27 professional matches to date.

Match by match results
